message_1: Suppose you have a plaintext message "MATH" and you want to encrypt it using a simple substitution cipher where each letter is shifted three positions to the right in the alphabet. What will be the ciphertext message?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATH" using a simple substitution cipher with a shift of three positions to the right, we will replace each letter with the letter that is three positions ahead of it in the alphabet.

M -> P (M + 3 = P)
A -> D (A + 3 = D)
T -> W (T + 3 = W)
H -> K (H + 3 = K)

So, the ciphertext message will be "PDWK".
